campaign.story:
Hey Friends!
I'm extremely excited to share that The Burnt Ends, my vintage instrumental country band, have recently recorded our first album, titled Way Out There.
A few years ago I revisited some of my favorite classic country music from the 1940s-60s through new found vinyl record collections, such as Take Me Home Country Roads and Country & Western Music Jamboree. I fell back in love with the lush 3-part vocal harmonies and wanted to rearrange for horns and rhythm section, trying to breathe some different life into these old songs while paying respect to the original amazing storytellers and outlaws that played them.
The musicians that helped me on this quest across the sonic desert happen to be some of my closest friends, and amazing improvising musicians who I've had the pleasure of making music with for over the past 15 years here in New York City. With a common love of this music and juicy BBQ, and hailing from California, Colorado, St. Louis, Texas, Pittsburgh, New York and Germany, I knew everyone would bring a different flavor to this project.
This also wouldn't have been possible without the guidance of engineer, percussionist, and brilliant audio brain, Robin MacMillan. He really helped shape this project which could've gone in a million different directions.
SO, I can't wait to share this music with you all. But I want to do it right. It's already mixed and mastered, and I couldn't be happier with the way it sounds. But the goal of this Kickstarter is to also release it on vinyl. I want that needle to drop on your turntable next to the fireplace with a glass of bourbon in hand while relaxing in grandma's rocking chair with a golden retriever sleeping at your feet.
Please check out the video above and if you like what you hear we would be much obliged if you pledged and helped this meaty dream become a reality!
- Kyle & The Burnt Ends Crew

About Lindsay:
Hello friends! Thank you for visiting my Kickstarter. For those of you who don’t know me, I’m a singer-songwriter based out of Toronto (though I’m originally from Boston!). I’ve been singing for as long as I can remember, and have been hooked on songwriting since high school. Over the past 4 years, I’ve released a full album (From the Blue) and an EP (Going Gone), and have toured several times throughout Canada and the United States. I’ve also had the honor of being a finalist in both the Canadian Songwriting Competition and the Songwriter Serenade Competition (2017, 2018). Oh and I’ve written a whole bunch of songs!
About the Project:
This project will be a 6 song EP exploring vulnerability, self-doubt, love, and the search for home. Some of these songs have been in the works for almost two years, some are brand new. This will be my second release with my amazing crew in Toronto. For our first EP, we took just 3 days in the studio and recorded most of it live off the floor. I’m very proud of that project, but this time around I wanted to take things up a notch.
I hired a producer, Joel Schwartz, to bring this project to a new level, and I’ve been floored with what we’ve created. Over the past 6 months, Joel and I have been working to edit, refine, and arrange these songs. At this point, we’ve finished pre-production and rehearsals, and are tracking in the studio as we speak!! I’ve learned a lot through this process, and it’s been SO MUCH fun. And the bonus is that I think we have created something really special.
Why Kickstarter?
I believe in these songs, and I REALLY want to give them a fair chance to be heard out in the world. Unfortunately, in this day and age, it’s almost impossible to get your music heard as an unsigned artist without a whole lot of money to pay for a PR campaign and radio/digital promoters. Funds from this Kickstarter will help make that happen. With a PR team, we’ll launch a publicity campaign to really get the word out and reach new listeners! I’ll also hire digital and radio promoters who will pitch these songs to folk radio stations and Spotify playlists.
Budget:
There are so many costs involved in creating and releasing music independently. The band and I recorded at Soleil Sound in mid-October, and will be working on post production through November. So we are well on our way to having a finished product!
The funds collected in this campaign will be put towards:
Mixing and Mastering- $3000. 
CD Manufacturing- $1000. This includes album artwork and CD duplication. 
Promotion- $3000. Promotion of the EP with a PR team so that lots of people can hear it!!
Total: $7000
Stretch Goal- $1000 for a live music video of NYC to help with promotion of the EP, bringing the total to $8000. 
Thank You
I am so excited that this collection of songs will soon be finished, and it means the world to me that you have visited this page and considered supporting this project. If you are unable to contribute financially, I would love your help in spreading the word. If you know anyone that you think would connect with my music, I would love it if you sent them my way!
If you would like to stay updated on future releases, tours, join my mailing list, or check out more music, feel free to visit my website at https://www.lindsayfoote.com/.
Ok, I think that’s it! Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for supporting us independent musicians. It allows us to keep doing what we love everyday, and I am so grateful.
Love,
Lindsay
Part of the crew after our second day in the studio!

STRETCH GOAL!
I can't believe it... we did it, and with 12 days remaining! 
So here's the deal....
Stretch Goal Amount: 8,000
What You'll Get: Still brainstorming this, but I'm all ears! My inclination is to record another single or EP, completely different from this album, with the sole intention of giving this music to you all. There are a couple songs that come to mind that many of you have asked me to record (like "Pour Over Me").
Where Will The Money Go: Small national radio promotion campaign (which costs 1,500)
Hey there, my name is Sarah Eide (pronounced Ay-Duh).
I’m a pianist, composer and singer-songwriter, and I’m looking for your help in releasing my first fully produced full length album, “Dreams on Hold”.
I’ve been playing and writing music for as long as I can remember, and for just as long I’ve felt this deep sense of purpose as an artist and creator.  
It’s a hard thing to admit publicly, but it’s been a calling, and I’ve never abandoned it. My purpose and mission as an artist has been simply to create music that positively impacts others. Along with that sense of purpose, I’ve always worked towards creating art that fulfills three things:
That it’s beautiful and proficient 
That it possesses a vulnerable quality
That it’s driven by a vision 
All my favorite albums are like that, and I believe I’ve achieved that with this album.
“Dreams on Hold” is about the conflict between what we are working towards and life’s twists and turns.
It’s about those moments when you feel like you're at tug of war between your aspirations and life’s priorities. Those moments when you're not sure if the sacrifices your making are making any difference. But also those moments when you look back and realize that the unexpected twists and turns ended up offering more joy then you could have ever imagined for yourself. 
In short, I’ve made an album the I believe is vulnerable and moving.
The sonic landscape of this album is heavily influenced by American roots music.
Everything from Appalachian folk to New Orleans jazz, and bluegrass to gospel. This is the music that’s been inspiring me for the past few years, and for me, this is the kind of music that is most like an unfiltered expression of everyday life in its spontaneity and warmth. 
The team I've pulled together is truly amazing. 
This album sounds AMAZING, and so much of that is due to the incredible group of Chicago based musicians I’ve been able to work with, all of whom have their own amazing projects.
While I’m the songwriter and producer of this album, every song on this record has been a collaboration with each of these talented folk,  who’ve all (generously) left their unique mark. 
So much is ALSO due to the fantastic, professional, meticulous, perhaps OBSESSIVE engineers I've had the pleasure to work with (Anthony Gravino, Yuri Lysoivanov and Victoria  Salazar) and the studios I was lucky enough to record in (Transient Sound, Chicago Recording Company, Electric Audio and Flashpoint Chicago). 
And by the way, back in January of this year I released the first single off this album, "Shadow" (a 2017 Great American Song Contest Finalist)! 
The album is done, but here comes the scary part...
I’ve invested a WHOLE BUNCH to get this far...money, time, blood, sweat and all the tears! But now it's time to put it out to the world. As you probably know, I’m an indie artist and currently, I wear all the hats. I really believe in this album and the impact it can make, and I need help and support. The reality is, there are still a number of things to do to give this album a proper release, and they aren’t free :)
The successful completion of this Kickstarter campaign will allow me to:
create music videos for TWO songs on the album
develop promotional material (professional photos, press release, etc)
get some basic PR (guerrilla style PR!)
Anything PAST my goal, means I’ll be able to promote this album even MORE, for example tour with a band after the album is released, pay for a proper radio campaign, make more video content... 
In short: more funding → better marketing → bigger impact 
So I would LOVE for you to join me in allowing this album to make the biggest impact possible. 
For any pledge amount over $5 you get a NEW single from the album within 48 hours  and a handwritten thank you note from me <3
For any pledge amount over $15 you get a digital copy of the album by February, which is months before the official release (May 2019)!  And for $25 and over you get a physical copy of the album sent to you by snail mail in April.
I’m also offering a bunch of extras, which you can see in the rewards section, like t-shirts or totes, tickets to a show of your choice, a holiday bundle full of super nice handcrafted items, house shows, songwriting session, and more! And if you don't see a reward you are hoping for, please email me and lets figure something out! 
And by the way, any pledge amount will allow you to get updates and follow the journey of the album. The way I see it, ALL my backers are on my team!
Want to help in other ways?
Please help me get the word out! Kickstarter is an all or nothing platform, so time is of the essence! Spread the word, share this with your friends and family, share this on social media. Word of mouth is the most powerful thing, and your eagerness to share this project with others and encourage them to help me make the goal is EXTREMELY meaningful and deeply appreciated :)
Thank you, your support means the world to me. 
I value you and the time you've given simply to read this and consider helping. It sincerely means the world to me. 
I can’t wait to see how the journey of this album unfolds and I can’t wait to share that experience with all of you!

Hi, I'm Brooke Annibale. 
I'm making a new record. It's almost finished and I'd like you to be a part of it!
OK WOW. We reached the goal and then some. BUT THERE'S MORE. I've got special bonus rewards that everyone will get, if we keep going:
IF WE REACH $10,000 I’ll write and home demo a brand new song, that everyone who’s backed the project will receive, exclusively. (CHECK. DONE. WE DID IT. I'LL START WRITING.)
IF WE REACH $15,000 I’ll also record a 3 song EP of acoustic versions of my songs, new or old. You get to vote on which songs I record. (CHECK, AGAIN! WE DID IT.  BACKERS-ONLY SURVEY AVAILABLE IN THE UPDATES SECTION)
**NEW GOAL: IF WE REACH $20,000** I’ll ALSO record a 3 song EP of cover songs. You get to vote on which cover songs I record, from a list I’ll provide.
I've even got a few more incentives in mind if somehow we surpass those goals (which would be INSANE AND ALSO AWESOME). 
All the fun details below!
Since the release of my 2015 record, The Simple Fear, I’ve been quite busy. I started focusing on writing this record in the fall of 2016. I sat down with the song ideas that I’d had over the last year and found new ideas hiding out somewhere in my heart and mind. I always think that no more songs will exist in me, but somehow they do. I’m grateful for that. I’ve always said that making music is my passion in life, and there’s nothing better than working really hard on little pieces of songs and watching them turn into an entire record that’s ready to share.
RECORDING: 
SAM KASSIRER // GREAT NORTH SOUND SOCIETY
I met producer Sam Kassirer in the fall of 2016, and we really hit it off. I’d been a fan of Sam for a while mostly via his work with Josh Ritter and Lake Street Dive (to name a few). We got together to work on two songs in the winter of 2017. It went really well and we decided to make an entire record together. Throughout the summer of 2017 we worked on 9 more songs at his remote studio, Great North Sound Society, in Parsonsfield, Maine. We invited some great musicians (and Sam's dog Lucy) to join us. After a lot of hard work (and a lot of fun times) we ended up with a full length record of 11 songs and it’s ALMOST ready to release. 
Clockwise from upper left: Sam Kassirer (The Producer of the Record!) // Lucy The Dog // The Studio! Great North Sound Society // Cristobal (Cello) & Jenna (Violin)
  Clockwise from upper left: Zachariah Hickman (Bass) // Me // Sean Trischka (Drums) & Ariel Bernstein (Engineering + Drums) // Josh Kaufman (Additional Guitars)
INVESTMENT + NEED
I've already invested some of (ok, I'll be honest MOST of) my personal savings into making this record, and I could use your help to take it over the finish line. As some of you may know, this is not my first record or my first crowdfunded project. The challenges of making a record come with the territory. For me, the biggest reward and the energy that keeps me inspired comes from playing my songs for you. With this next record I hope to tour more extensively (across the USA and beyond) and share it with as many new ears as I can reach. 
My goal is set at $7,500, which helps cover my basic remaining costs. It's just enough to get the record finished. Your support will help fund: final producer fees, mixing, mastering, manufacturing costs, and promotional costs.
BUT IF WE REACH THAT GOAL... THERE'S MORE. If we're able to reach $7.5k and keep going I've got special bonus rewards that everyone will get.

I've even got a few more incentives in mind if somehow we surpass those goals (which would be INSANE AND ALSO AWESOME).

campaign.story:
"What if this is the last show you ever play?"
I asked myself this question one snowy night in Pittsburgh at a show in Squirrel Hill. It was right around my birthday in 2016. The stage fright that started after my mom passed away had only been getting worse; I was ready to hang up my hat and take a break.  My first live show was in 1996 and I'd been touring or performing in some capacity since then.  
I made my set list and played the songs I would play if it was my last show. It was an awesome night. I relaxed. I breathed into it. I let go.  
Which brings me to now.  
The news can be dire. There seems to be trouble afoot everywhere I look. But now is not the time to surrender to the grief. To hopelessness. To doubt. Now, more than ever, artists are needed to rise up and do their part to bring comfort, passion, love, a voice of the resistance, rage, hope and even despair.  
Daniel Marcus and I took THE set list from THAT snowy Pittsburgh night and set to work. We hunkered down in his studio late at night after his daughter was asleep and before his new baby was born.
We worked with several trusted musicians and friends who respected our vision and helped me get the sound I envisioned.
It's almost done. I saved up and paid for it up to this point, but I hope you'll join me in paying the folks who are helping me finish this album.  
These are my "I don't want to quit music without playing these songs live one more time" songs. This album made me fall in love with art all over again. I hope they'll make you happy (and sad and mad and hopeful) too. Thank you for being part of this project.  
 This goal includes payment for production of the CD (aka: paying Dan for all of his hard work), mastering with Maria Rice, CD artwork (I am making a very limited number of physical copies - pre-ordering here is your best chance of getting one), and fees for Kickstarter.  
Stretch Goals - 
I will break even with the $10,600 goal, meaning all the other artists and the co-producer and the masterer will be paid.
MARKETING/PROMOTION: I'd love to hire a professional who can help me promote this album for radio and film work. I estimate an additional $3000 for this.
PAYING MYSELF: It's funny... I feel weird asking to get paid. I can't exactly count the hours I have spent working to create these songs, because they are part of the fabric of my life. I'd love to be able to pay myself for my work on this project. And I'll take anything beyond the $13,600 mark as payment for myself. (PS - this is Frances. Hi everyone! I am very excited about this FREAKIN' AWESOME album, and Judith deserves equal pay for equal work! Woot! Show some green!)
Oh. My gosh, Frances.
Thank you!!
Love, Judith

campaign.story:
My new album, Slow The Devil, is almost finished! Pre-order it through this campaign to help me get my music & message out into the world!
PLAY

 Stretch Goal #1: $15,000 - Radio Promotion, particularly for internet radio and streaming services like Spotify & Pandora, is one of the biggest ways that indie artists get huge exposure. Landing a spot on a playlist is a primary goal of mine that would place my music and message in front of a worldwide audience!
Stretch Goal #2: $20,000 - Tour + press and booking - Tour press is essential for getting the word out about shows in places where I’ve never played. Music connects us, and it’s even more powerful in live performance. My soul speaks directly to your soul, and I can assure you that your soul speaks back to mine. :) 
Stretch Goal #3: $30,000 - International Tour in 2018 - In this day and age, we live in a truly global community. Hand-in-hand with streaming, international touring opens up the opportunity to engage new audiences and can be a meaningful contributor to growing my fanbase.
Photo by Bryce Johnson, from the "Slow The Devil" music video shoot
The Story
I started writing songs for this new album over a year ago but the story, the REAL STORY, begins not with a song, but with a conversation... 
Several months ago, I posted this on my blog:
"One morning, I woke up with a song in my head. ‘Slow The Devil’ was a gift from the songwriting gods and the closest thing I’ve ever written to a protest song. I realized that the music was helping me through these dark times of uncertainty and disconnect.” 
Shortly after publishing that blog post, I learned that one of my friends, a key member of my creative team with whom I've enjoyed working for years and for whom I have massive amounts of respect and trust, was on the opposite side of the political spectrum from me. I had to ask myself some hard questions. I’ve declared that my goal is to help create Unity, but will my song only create further divisiveness? As an artist, I refuse to compromise, but is there a bigger and more important message here? 
So, I did something I’d been dreading – I spoke with my friend, and despite my trepidation, we had a great conversation! One thing he said particularly resonated with me: “We may have voted differently, but at the heart of everything, we are more alike than we are different.” When I thought about the way he and I live our lives, and the interests we share, I knew he was right.
We can have causes we stand for and opinions we hold dear, but that one crucial conversation with my friend reminded me how much we need to LISTEN to one another. What we really need is understanding: finding common ground through conversation.
My last album was about loving what makes you different. In the past two years that conversation has evolved and deepened. Slow The Devil is a call for Unity & Connection, through not only loving what makes you different, but loving what makes others different as well. ‘Unity’ doesn’t mean we should all be the same. Unity is about celebrating diversity! Each of us is a unique blend of biological inheritance and personal experience, yet as my friend said, “At the heart of everything, we are more alike than we are different.”
Make Your Pledge Today 
How do the rewards work, you ask? Check this out…. 
I’m beyond excited to announce that I will also be releasing this record to Limited Edition Vinyl! You can order just the vinyl package, or if you’d like one of the higher level rewards, simply select that reward and add an additional $15 (for Domestic U.S.) or $25 (for International) to your pledge at checkout for the upgrade to vinyl. Please note that there is a longer turnaround time for vinyl than for CDs, but I promise it will be worth the wait!
 **FOR INTERNATIONAL ORDERS* the vinyl upgrade is $25 to include shipping costs.
Every order over $100 comes in the "Slow The Devil" tote bag!
The Music
"Robyn is a true artist who forever continues to grow into the hearts of her fans. Her upcoming recordings will connect with you at a deep and honest level. She will give you more than you can imagine."
- Brad Chapman, Multi-Platinum Vocal Producer
I knew it was going to take a gifted and adventurous producer to fully bring this music to life. Blending electronic and organic instrumentation, producer Caleb Loveless crafted tracks that range from beautifully intimate to majestically epic. The album is a journey, beginning with the call to arms of “Slow The Devil,” through the battle cries of “This Means War,” the emotional aftermath of “Fallout,” and bringing us back together in the healing harmonies of “Bit By Bit.” 
PRODUCER: Caleb Loveless AKA COAV - Has written and produced songs that have been streamed millions of times around the world and used by major brands such as Coca-Cola, Microsoft, Vevo, MTV, and E! Network. Also, the most wonderful person to work with, and I just can't say enough good things about him!
VOCAL PRE-PRODUCTION: Brad Chapman - Los Angeles-based celebrity vocal coach, specializing in capturing authenticity and emotion in vocal recordings. He has been awarded 23 RIAA Platinum Records and 45 Platinum Records worldwide.
MIXING: Brenden Bytheway - half of the duo Scott & Brendo, his songs and mixes have been featured in some of the most viral videos on YouTube and heard by over 1 billion people. 
MASTERING: Elysian Masters - They’ve mastered records by legendary artists, including M83, Rodriguez, Fitz & the Tantrums, Bob Marley & The Wailers, Isaac Hayes, and Paramore. 
This album also features an All-Star cast of collaborators and contributors: 
STOLAR - NYC based Singer/Songwriter and co-writer of several songs on the album. Brilliant, brilliant songwriter.
Callie Crofts - Billboard charting singer/songwriter, YouTuber, and frontwoman of My Fair Fiend. Callie lends gorgeous layered harmonies to many of the songs on the album.
Zac Bryant - Drummer for a whole slew of notable projects, including My Fair Fiend, Reflektor, GirafficJam, Callie Crofts (oh yeah, they’re engaged!) and the Crofts Family Christmas. 
Alyse Black - Singer/Songwriter, she's performed on NPR, recorded a commercial for Target, and is the winner of Billboard's Annual Songwriting Contest. Alyse and I wrote "Bit By Bit" on the first day we met!
Cari Cole Voice & Music and The Artist Success Circle - Mastermind group headed by my music business mentor, Cari Cole, who also just happens to be a celebrity vocal coach. Over the past several years, Cari's mentorship has changed my career and my life for the better, in so many ways. 
Carla Boecklin Photography
The Visuals 
Carla Boecklin Photography - Genius photographers Carla Boecklin and her husband and business partner Vita Krompl are two of my favorite people. I show up with chainmail, a faux Wolfskin, a feather boa, a sheer cloth, and metal armor, and Carla shows up with an industrial fan. The result? Wild, crazy gorgeousness. 
Bryce Johnson Visuals - It’s a good thing that Bryce is as adventurous as I am (if not more so!) because every shoot we do together involves some kind of insanity. Like climbing up a rope on an icy cliffside to get to a frozen waterfall in a cave. Or dragging an antique piano AND a 300 lb cast-iron tub into the desert. Or lighting a piano on fire. No matter what crazy idea I come up with, Bryce always turns it into pure visual magic. 
Devore Artistry - Amy Devore is the hair & makeup artist behind every single one of my music videos and photo shoots. Seriously, I hardly dare step in front of a camera without having Amy there to bring out my inner rock star. :) 
CCXA - Delaney Gibson possesses some kind of crazy psychic intuition. She has an uncanny ability to read the vibe of an artist and create visuals and branding concepts that are SO PERFECT for that artist. OH, and she’s also an amazing singer-songwriter with upcoming releases from her band SIGNY. Delaney created the merch designs and logos for this campaign and also helped with creative consulting.
Slow The Devil glassware, the Unisex Tee, and the Ladies Tank Top
The Money 
In order to make the most of the opportunities I receive and create, I must put out the best, highest quality product possible. The team I’ve recruited to make this album are at the top of their game, and I am so thankful that they’ve agreed to help me bring this music to life. Producing a broadcast quality record and premium content is a huge investment, but it’s absolutely worth it to realize the full potential of this project.
Now the only thing missing is you.
Your support will enable us to finish recording the last few songs, and have the album mixed and mastered. Our goal of $10,000 is just enough to get the album released into the world and supported by a basic promotional campaign.
Bonus: Since over half the songs are already finished and ready to go, you’ll have the full album in your hands (or on your phone) before the end of 2017!
Here’s a breakdown of where the money will go if the project is successfully funded: 
The funds that go to PR, radio promotion, making videos, and spreading the word are a vital part of the plan. Your pledge of support is the first step, but there is so much more you can do to help beyond your donation. Please share this project with your friends, on social media, with anyone who might enjoy my music. Word of mouth is incredibly powerful. Together, we’ve got a good shot of getting this record noticed. 
Alright, LET'S DO THIS!! 
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support, and as always, love wastefully, for love is never wasted. 
xoxo, 
Robyn 
From my desert songwriting sabbatical
"A captivating storyteller!" - Music Connection Magazine
Photo by Carla Boecklin Photography
“Ethereal, seductive and haunting…Like her idols, Sarah McLachlan, Tori Amos and Fiona Apple, Cage's music possesses the same bold, raw edge.” - Ruidoso News

              ___________________________________________________________
 Hi, my name is Joy Ike. Chances are that if you're reading this, you know me in some capacity - maybe you've come to a few shows over the years, follow me on social media, or maybe you came across a few videos, downloaded a few songs, and have been following from a distance.
Whoever you are, thanks for visiting this page, watching the above video, and reading this! 
I've been trying to figure out how best to share my vision for this next project without feeling the pressure of trying to 'convince' you into giving me your money. I prefer 'excite' :) Admittedly there's a lot of pressure with these things. But I guess here's what I want to say... 
THE MAIN THING
Music is an odd thing. It's one of the few things that we can't physically touch, but it affects us more deeply than anything else. Kind of like love. This is why I will always argue that every song is in some way a love song - maybe to a person, maybe to God, maybe to something else. 
9 years ago I quit my job to make music more seriously. I had NO IDEA what i was doing. But I felt absolutely compelled to do it. This is why I know I am still here...making music. 
 That compelling feeling that got me started is still just as strong and alive in my heart right now. 
There has never been a moment when I didn't expect a song (didn't have to be mine) to soften someone's demeanor, pacify a tense situation, give a mother permission to mourn, comfort in times of loneliness, and empower a weak spirit. This intangible thing somehow magically moves mountains and can wreck a persons life in every possible good way! 
 And it's why i make music. 
THE ALBUM 
This album is different... Each time I think of how to describe it, "raw" is the only word that hits the nail on the head. The theme is big and bold and the songs are lush and vibrant. Very rhythm-heavy and full of movement. 
This is the first album that has nothing to do with me! Instead, this batch of songs, written over the past 3 years, explores the affect our personal relationships have on us and how that in turn alters, enhances, and influences how we move through the world, respond to injustice, and love our neighbor. It's a political album that has nothing to do with politics! And it's a completely different sound! One I can't wait to share with you all!!! 
THE GOAL 
The goal is big! I am raising $15,000 to fund the production, mixing, mastering, hiring musicians, album design, and duplication. There is alot going into this to make this album the best it can be, give these songs their best opportunity, and create something that will tell the story of an age. 
Kickstarter is All or Nothing! So if I don't reach the total goal, it means I don't get to keep any of the donated amount.
THE HOPE 
When people hear my music, I want them to feel at home in it - to sit in it, rest in it, and feel known...understood. But lately I've especially been wanting to light things on fire...figuratively speaking, of course! I want listeners to get a little fire in their bones. These songs are like a piece of newspaper in a stack of wood - starting the flame that makes the whole thing burn. They exist to rumble and inspire. I've nicknamed many of them "kickboxing" songs because i want the music to empower listeners and give them their second wind. I want you to be a part of this project b/c these songs are for you! They always have been! 
With love,
Joy

Summary:
I am an artist-scientist bringing my award winning photographic series to book format for the first time. "Ozymandias" explores the endless and beautiful dance between creation and destruction, which gives rise to everything around us. Rewards for supporters include the book, limited-edition archival prints, and postcards - all come with a HUGE thank you! Also, you keep 100% of your pledge if the funding goal is not reached in time. Rewards will be in your hands in the first week of December - just in time for the holiday season!
About Me and My Journey:
This line of work began in the dust and decay. While researching cancer at the Universität Potsdam in Germany, I began taking photos of the local abandoned train stations and factories. I loved it, and expanded my travels to neighboring Belgium, Italy, and Poland to capture decaying castles and palaces. Vaulted ceilings and chandeliers spoke to an opulent past; layers of paint and wallpaper marked chapters in the buildings’ history; a piano stood tuned to the passing of time. What stories were resting here!
Beelitz, Germany
Among the many reflections promoted by such spaces is the idea that our buildings, our stories, will too fade, to be replaced with new buildings and stories. I began exploring and developing these ideas through photography. My first exhibition, "The Gilded and The Faded", juxtaposed vitality and creation with abandonment and destruction. However, the more time I spent pursuing this concept, the more I realized this was a false dichotomy. Because creation and destruction necessarily and unequivocally lead to the other, they shouldn’t be considered separate or isolated; they are a cycle, and two halves of the same whole. Each contains the seed for the other. And so the concept for "Ozymandias" was born.
Italy
I happened to meet a girl during a research program at MIT AMGEN that summer who convinced me to take the next year off from school with her. Our subsequent travels, again structured around international research at Cambridge University and the University of Melbourne, provided much of the material for the book. Brianna has been an unending source of inspiration ever since, and has been indispensable in the creation of this book.
Luke and Brianna
The Book as an Object:
The hardcover, approximately 10x12 inch coffee-table-style-book will feature over 100 pages of photographs, and materials will be of the highest quality. I have years of experience printing archival, museum quality photographs and will be working with an experienced book printer who specializes in photography books. I have no doubt the book will be a work of art in and of itself.

Come, be part!  Should this Kickstarter campaign be successful, it will fund my 8th studio album (likely) entitled "Ballads",  a weaving of American roots music; my first album of cover songs. I can honestly say I've been wanting to make this album my whole career.  There will be jazz ballads next to traditional songs and swing and blues - it's all roots music. I will self-produce live recording sessions featuring some of the greatest musicians in the music business today, paying tribute to some of our beloved masters of yesterday (Bessie Smith, Billie Holiday, Nat King Cole, Johnny Cash, Nina Simone, John Coltrane, Miles Davis, Bobbie Gentry to name a few.) I need your help to fund live recording sessions in a professional studio, accommodating brilliant musicians and their instruments coming from various parts of America (Dennis Crouch from Nashville, TN - Chris Bruce and Jay Bellerose from Los Angeles, for instance), mixing and mastering sessions to complete the audio.  Also the cost of art design, production of CDs, vinyl and T shirts will be covered by this campaign. 
Stretch Goal:  Any additional money above the goal of $60K will allow me to further the project with a video and needed publicity. I sincerely hope to make a gorgeous album of standards for the world to hear, but the world will need to know. Publicity and marketing is very costly.  I ask you to be part of my team and join me in this dream to manifest my own album of covers (instead of singing on everyone else's albums - or being told what to do by a record company!)  Thank you profoundly for your support.  Love, Paula.

campaign.story:
Bird on a Wire presents For Those Who Cannot Fly, a show exploring the visceral effects of walls, lines, and borders. We will be performing in San Francisco at the FURY Factory Festival of Ensemble and Devised Theater 2016, as part of their Raw Materials series. This is an opportunity to perform and engage with the audience about our 20-minute, work-in-progress performance (which will eventually develop into a full 75-90 minute production). We need your help to kickstart our funding for travel, material costs, and stipends.

For Those Who Cannot Fly is about all that holds us in, keeps us out, contains and restrains. Over the past three years, we have been researching lines and walls: borders between countries (and states), prison walls, racist redlining, train tracks, and other lines/walls that divide space that used to be whole. As part of that research, we have also been visiting these places, collecting observations, stories, and our own responses. Now we are in the process of funneling our research and experiences into a performance exploring how a line or wall impacts the environment, people, and cultures it divides or interrupts. What changes when walls appear? How does a wall affect a life’s trajectory? Who/what is allowed to “cross” a line or wall, and who/what isn’t?

We have had very visceral feelings as we visit and cross walls and lines. Those visceral feelings are what we want to bring to audiences: The presence of a large wall. A barrier where there wasn’t one. A line that can’t be crossed. Our proximity to or distance from each other. Restricted movement. Things we can see or hear through walls, but not touch. The way touch changes if it's across a wall.

Our dream is to develop this show through our work at FURY Factory, then expand and take it on the road, encouraging community dialogue about the effects of borders, barriers, and walls.
                    For Those Who Cannot Fly is created by

Michelle Milne & Heidi Carlsen: Creator/Performers
Jerry Peters: Lighting Design and Tech Director 
Jenifer Alonzo: Dramaturg / Structure Detective  
Niels Carlsen: Set Realization
Alison Brookins: Fundraising
Keith Hiebner: Kickstarter Video
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After rehearsing at a distance, we are now looking forward to working together in the same space. This introduces new challenges: How to weave together work we have made separately, and how to do so in a highly compressed time frame. We will need to communicate clearly, throw ourselves into creative risks, and make decisions quickly. We have done this before, and are ready to do so again!

We also recognize that as white US citizens, our interactions with walls, borders, and barriers are different from a Guatemalan or Mexican family wanting to come to the US, for example. We also haven’t personally been incarcerated, so our perspective on being constrained to one side of a wall is based on the experience of visiting - and at the end of that visit, being forced to leave, rather than forced to stay. 

We have listened to and shared experiences with people who have spent time on the “other” side of these walls and borders - and we recognize that these barriers and lines affect our own freedom as well as theirs. We acknowledge the ways in which systems hurt, limit, and affect us all - and how meeting at, and crossing, walls and borders (if we have that privilege) can be life-changing and life-giving. 

Our hope is that this performance brings the feelings of that experience to more people, sparking dialogue across various walls in our world, and inspiring more people to cross divisive lines and connect along borders in their own neighborhoods, countries, and lives.

UPDATE: everyone who takes part will now get a dozen of my cover tunes! This will be sent as a bonus CD if you give $25 or more, otherwise you will receive it as a free download. Sweet ;).
THE WHY
I have released three solo albums and toured across the U.S.A., Canada and Mexico. Though I'm proud of my previous releases, they were recorded in humble circumstances and do not have the sound quality needed to stand alongside my peers in the musical world. Now that I've begun to find a real audience, it's time for me throw my hat in the ring with a full-fledged professional recording.
BACKGROUND
I spent many years studying jazz, classical, and flamenco, all the while playing in rock bands, but I never found what I looking for in any of those worlds. It was only after moving to Oaxaca, Mexico, that I wrote my first solo guitar piece, for a friend who asked me to play music at her wedding. Since then, I've been dedicated to writing original guitar music that incorporates all of my different experiences with inspiration from music all over the world.
ON TIME
The album will be titled "On Time". Even though it has taken me many years to figure out my musical direction, none of my experiences have been wasted. Though it's tempting to envy prodigies and other people who figure out their direction early in their lives, I know that the big step I'm making with this project is arriving neither too early nor too late, but just at the right time. 
The songs that I've written all have a highly rhythmic element, with influences from African, Latin and electronic music. The groove is paramount. I'll be making a solo guitar record that you can dance to!
THE LOOK
To accompany the music, I'll be making a complete package that will be a joy to hold in your hands. I've been working with a wonderful artist, Samantha Stooke, to design artwork for the cover, disc and inside pages, and I'm thrilled with how it's turning out. It perfectly matches what I'm trying to convey in these songs.
THE WHERE
Audible Images
I plan to record at Audible Images, a beautiful studio outside of Pittsburgh, which has hosted the likes of Dave Matthews, Airto Moreira, Marcus Miller, and the Ten Tenors, and has won Grammys along the way. I've met with the staff to discuss my project, and I'm thrilled that they will be working with me to produce the best album possible.
THE NEED
It ain't cheap to do this.

Hello and good day to you wonderful people! My name is Mandee and I have been performing professionally as "Phat Man Dee" since 1996. I have recorded and pressed 4 full length albums "Life Just Goes On" (2002), "Torch of Blue"(2007), "Merry ChristmaChannaKwanzaa Vol. 1.1" (2011) and my most recent release is "Hey Phat Chick! (ya had it comin' to ya!) 2014. I have always included songs in one of the 10 other languages I sing in, because I feel we are one planet, one people, we are all children of the divine, no matter what color our skin, what languages we sing in. (Quick note: The photo of me singing into a mic against the brick background is by photographer Roy Jones, Kent, OH)
Image by Chris Koontz Photography, shot at J J Jameson's Late Night Cabaret in Philadelphia, PA
Small sample of my music:
This year I am turning 40 years old and I am so excited to still be on the planet. I never thought I would make it this long!!!  I was born in Youngstown, OH, on February 12, 1975, the daughter of a school teacher/social justice activist and a railroad man/photographer. Since then I have played the roles of punk rawk circus sideshow marvel, bald poet, janitor, mung bean farmer, migrant farmer, part time prophet, cellist and sculptor.... all on my journey to become Phat Man Dee, a cabaret jazz icon in my own mind....and wife to the largest Amoeba on the planet. I have been blessed to make many wonderful friends and fans along the way.
Phat Man Dee and Tommy Amoeba's wedding, 2002!
If I have had the honor of singing for you during the past 20 years, then this puts you in a community of thousands of people, and it's quite likely I did so live and in person, maybe around a campfire, maybe at a belly dance exposition, circus or burlesque show, maybe from inside a bathtub 20 feet in the air, maybe at the Pittsburgh Opera or a Burning Opera, maybe at a roller rink, maybe in a cave or with flaming robots, or maybe I sang to you in a haunted hotel or at the Warhol Museum standing next to an original Dali, maybe I even sang to you in a jazz club, or perhaps while I was singing and flying on a zip line over the Gowanus River in the middle of the night, but chances are it was in person. I would like to share this live "Phat Man Dee" experience with more people, around the US, and around the world. I have not been outside the United States since my french club accompanied Mr Ghogomou to Paris when I was sixteen years old.
When Tommy Amoeba and I married, we asked that no one buy us anything. 13 years ago, we asked our guests who were artists for their own creation, or for a contribution to our house fund. That is how we were able to get our down payment on our house. Now we are settled and thoroughly entrenched in the beauty and art that I have always known Pittsburgh to be, I wish to spread the word of who we are, as artists, musicians, culture mavens.... to the world. I am about to launch my first ever online fundraising campaign. I have never been part of a kickstarter or other kind of online fundraising venture before and I hope this is received with as much excitement as I am having making it. Please, for my 40th birthday, will you please be part of this effort and help me bring my music and the music of those I love to an international audience? 
Please help me sing to the world. I shall video document my journey. I shall use this once in a lifetime opportunity to connect with musicians from all over the world. I collaborated last year with electronic musician Jensen from Germany last year, I sang on his cd, but I would like to sing with him in person. I have old musical friends from San Francisco who live in Belgium with whom I would like to play again. My friend Roby Edwards is a saxophonist who plays France and Germany regularly, I am sure if I could get  myself there, I would be able to line up performances, make fans and my goal is to meet someone to act as my booking agent. I spoke with a colleague of mine from Mr Smalls Theatre, Mr. El Jörge de Orsövay,  he used to tour manage for Anti Flag (big punk band from Pittsburgh) and asked how I should find an international agent.... His advice? He told me to get myself over there, and go meet the people in person..... that what you find on the internet isn't always real, what seems like the greatest club or festival in the world isn't what it appears in cyberspace.... and for the clubs and agents.... there are so many artists on the net trying to get something, it's really just better to go and suss it out in person.... The one solid gig I have lined up so far is in July at the World Body Painting Festival, held in Austria. My dear friend Foxy Moxy and her fiancee Scott Fray have won every single title offered by this presitigious festival and are now judges. This year they shall get married at the event, and they have requested I come sing to them for the wedding, on stage at this international festival celebrating art and the human body. I intend to use this event as a starting point to anchor around and I will line up smaller club hits and musical experiences in Paris, Berlin and Amsterdam. I have many international contacts who have invited me to come, but whatever money I may make singing my first time out of the US will not be enough to cover my expenses of getting there and getting back. I am asking for help, this first time, to go and meet the people I need to meet and sing to the people I need to sing to, in person, so I can work towards getting my band members and dancers I work with out of town with me so we can share with the world our music and our art. 
As a student of advanced video technique at Pittsburgh Filmmakers and as a video intern at Mr Small's Theatre, I have learned how to capture and present music through video, and I would like to combine my talents of music, travel and video to share my experiences in the world, with the world. I will present the video online in a travel journal on my youtube, blogs and website. I shall document the musical collaborations I have with the musicians I meet while I am there and present them in a web series video travel blog. As a citizen of Pittsburgh, America's city of bridges, I intend to seek out bridges on my travels and video myself singing on them, songs of mine, songs I learn along the way and new songs.... because a bridge is a special thing, it connects people.... physically and geographically, to one another, and I feel that Pittsburgh and its people are members of a global community, and I wish to exhibit this truth in a musical manner. When I return back home, I shall cut all the footage into a presentation that I shall show at Mr Smalls Theatre for one of their Creative.Life.Support Revival Series evenings. We will show highlights of video I made and I will teach my band to play the songs I learned and wrote while I was across the sea and we shall sing them for the good people of Pittsburgh. At my first ever big Mr Smalls Creative Life Support revival series show, I video skyped in my friend Colter Harper from Ghana and we sang together through the internet for the live audience in the theatre..... I wish to go to Ghana myself someday and I think going to Europe is the first step. 
I have a mission statement, though I never published it, it always just rang in my head. "Phat Man Dee is committed to bringing world class art and music to Pittsburgh and sharing our world class art and music with the world." Please help me and be part of this process and together we will show the world through music and dance, that Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania knows how to get down.

I applied last year for the same "Investing in Professional Artists" grant, though it was for a completely different project, and I was denied, so I do not know if I will get it this year, I have never gotten a grant from these people before... IF BY THE GRACE OF GOD AND THE GODDESS I RECEIVE THIS GRANT AND SUCCESSFULLY FUND THIS CAMPAIGN, I WILL USE THIS MONEY TO TRAVEL TO EITHER BRING MY BAND ALONG FOR THE RIDE FOR CERTAIN GIGS OR I WILL GO TO INDIA AND AFRICA. And, really, the last several weeks have been a kind of blur.... we documented everything, so it's all on tape, and we will edit it and get it into a movie form when we get home.... but really, we have been changing locations every 3 or 4 days and it's just long enough to make a couple friends, or reconnect with old ones, sing on bridges, go to jam sessions, make plans for future ventures and I am deep down tired and exhausted through every bone and fiber....I think I am on my 27th wind right now..... I have been trying to post pictures and videos on my facebook page..... I have two now.... the one I have always had for my music which is http://www.facebook.com/PhatManDee and my new one, for this video documentary project which is http://www.facebook.com/TakeItToTheBridgeWithPhatManDee I hope you will "Like" it and "Share" it.

I have been going at it hard, friends! I have seen some truly amazing things, met some incredible musicians, crossed some phenomenal bridges, big small, old, new.... sung with some delightful people and made some wonderful new friends and fans! It has been a very difficult and emotionally wrought journey, but I wouldn't trade a single moment of it for anything in the world.....
We left Pittsburgh, PA amid much consternation, did we have everything we needed??? Or had I brought too much? Would people even like my voice? Would i be too pushy, and seen as some loud mouth American (which I kind of actually am???) Would I know enough words in their languages to not look like a jagoff? How do you use a bidet? What do you mean flipping someone off in Germany is illegal and punishable by up to 1000 euro fine? Would I be able to carry my heavy luggage onto boats and trains and busses and over the bridges I so wanted to see and sing on? Would we lose all the camera gear in an absinthe inspired jazz brawl under a 1000 year old bridge in Prague? All of that (except I didn't flip anyone off in Germany, cuz it's not the kind of thing I do anyways and did I mention that if you do it really is illegal??? And also we didn't fight anyone under Charles Bridge, though some drunk crusty spangers were giving us the "hey you look like you might be carrying $2000 worth of camera gear stink eye", but I "hey man, you aren't the only crazy person here" look and stunk eyed them right back and they left us alone....)

Dear friends the journey begins! I'm departing Pittsburgh as we speak. I'm terrified, exhilarated, sitting at the airport wondering what I will see, who I will meet, if they will like my songs and want to play with me.... I shall walk through this next door, into my future and I know that whatever happens, it is because of the love, support and artistic power of my community that I am able to make this incredible journey. Thank you! Please follow our youtube channel "Take it to the Bridge" for video updates and video postcards along the way! I have been writing and composing music and songs for about 13 years. I grew up in Pittsburgh following my heart the way my family taught. I attended college at Valparaiso University, where I studied music. Having voice as an instrument of focus, I learned a great amount from performing and private lessons. In my college career I was a lead singer/songwriter for a three piece folk band called “The Still Life” where I honed my songwriting and band leading capabilities. 
After graduating college, I separated from that project to pursue more work on my solo career. Writing, singing, teaching, jamming, playing songs, jingles, and anything that came out of me through some creative force, I took my performance to a new level. Performing around the Pittsburgh area from the far south suburbs to the center of downtown, I have been growing as a person and artist. For example, the open mic scene around town has offered new friendships and collaborations on others music as well as my own. I learned the depth at which my writing could be taken.
There has always been a deep side to me about the concepts of existence. I found in my writing I was able to discuss and express myself. A true example of my view ….. I have always existed as the question of what our purpose is and where we are going. By “we” I mean as a unified group of existence: Humans, animals, plants, the earth, the universe. We all have so much we cannot deny is unified. We are together in this existence. I find supporting and caring for others lives’ brings more positivism to our own. It is equally about pursuing our own dreams, or pursuing what it is that brings us happiness. My goal in my life is to encourage and aid others in their growth of life. 
I pursue my beliefs through my music. I share them. I sing, shout, pour, and am elated in doing so. I am blessed to be capable of this. Without everything we go through in life we wouldn’t be who we are. Without everything I have lived, I could not be who I am, pursuing what I am pursuing and dreaming as I dream. Hence, I am reaching out through this Kickstarter to be given an opportunity to record a professional quality album.
 In this album I am discussing more on my beliefs and opinions on life and existence, as many creative folk do, this is my take. With your aid, I will give my first public portrayal of existence, struggle, and growth through recorded performance. Fear. Love. Every other emotion stems from these and I am eager to share my limited perspective with you. I have never worked with a studio where I felt I was able to really release my passion, heart, determination, or focused energy until now. This also includes a respectful and equal partnership. 
Ultimately I have never been able to create a professional quality album. Through the open mic scene, I met an equal who was interested in aiding me in my pursuit of a solo album. We grew in understanding of each other’s goals, learned about each other’s passions, and decided we should try to create a professional quality product. With your aid, I will be able to record out of Soundscape Studio with Michael Anthony Cirelli as the engineer. Thank you for your love and support now and in the future.  
Sincerely yours, 
 Jeremy Caywood

Welcome to the pre-sell of my book, The Conversation We COULD Be Having.
This book is for everyone, but it's ESPECIALLY for You -- the folks I call the "hidden demographic,"  What does that mean, you ask?  Well, read on:
If you are open-minded, progressive, and thoughtful, then this book is for you. 
If you don’t consider yourself an "activist," and yet still want to engage on the topic of race -- not only regarding social justice, but also cultural exchange and friendship -- then this book is for you.
If you do consider yourself an activist, then this book is also for you -- because, even though we may have different approaches, we are still working toward the same righteous end: total EQUALITY for ALL PEOPLE.
If you want a space where you're not asked to be the "representative of your race," then this book is for you.
If you're a white person who is not in denial about the need for this conversation -- but also someone who doesn't resonate with the "you MUST admit you're racist, even if you don't think you are" white-guilt approach -- then this book is for you. (In other words, you get that white people and people of color still aren't treated equally in this country, but rather than guilt and shame, you'd like to bring your "whole humanity" to the program.)
If you are a person of color who is a bit weary of explaining "racial" things to white people, and yet also don't necessarily consider yourself an activist, then this book is for you.
If you are not afraid to talk about race, but often feel like you don't really know how to, then this book is for you.

HOW I GOT STARTED IN ALL OF THIS
I was about eight years old, in the mid 70's, looking at images from the Civil Rights Movement, in the big TIME/LIFE book on my grandmother's coffee table.  I was simply riveted.  I didn't fully comprehend what I was looking at, but I knew it was something of great import.  That was the seed of my calling.
Ultimately, I became a musician, painter and educator --  and began to use the arts as a catalyst for a different kind of conversation about race.
In the Spring of 2000, I realized a 20-year dream and debuted my full-length "concept album" called The Divided States of America. After years of creating and implementing programs on race, I began to notice a phenomenon: a “hidden demographic” of people who really wanted to connect across lines of race -- socially, professionally, and intellectually -- but who didn’t have “a way in.”
In “The Conversation We COULD Be Having,” I offer a new paradigm for race relations in America. I describe how -- by engaging each person’s “whole humanity” -- we can move beyond narrowly defined roles, to a place of far greater understanding, connection, and relationship.
Something is brewing. There is a zeitgeist forming – an opportunity before us. All over the country, members of this hidden demographic want something more -- something more holistic, more accessible, more generative.  I truly believe that this book could help so many people because it meets a huge unmet need that's out there.  The hidden demographic represents a lever for social change. Imagine a place where coffee fuels creativity.
Imagine, EXpresso Coffee.
A place where:
 the passion and creativity of youth are nurtured and encouraged
a venue where young musicians have a stage that is dedicated to the eXpression of their talent
where an eXplosion of paint interrupts white walls
where physical manifestations of sculptors' dreams extend from the floor.Imagine all of this, complimented by the taste and aroma of exceptional coffee and pastries or eXquisite pairing of soup and panini sandwiches.
What you are imagining...is EXpresso Coffee.
Your support on Kickstarter will go to support the following:
Audio Equipment for the recording of a live CD.
Remodeling the space in order to create an art gallery that is customizable to each artist's work as well as an elevated stage.
Production cost for the full length live CD of featured musicians.
Production cost for a calendar of the artists featured through out the year of the project.
At the end of the year, EXpresso Coffee will produce:
A 15 month calendar featuring 13 young artists (Drea Bolen, and 12 others selected by a panel of judges throughout the year).
A 4 song EP by Tyree Morgan
A 12 song live CD of selections from young musicians to be selected by a panel of judges throughout the year.
After the project year ends, EXpresso Coffee will continue to produce an annual calendar and live CD as an ongoing venue for youth in the arts.
An opportunity for eXposure...
This social venture will literally use the cafe venue to fuel the creativity of youth. The cafe will give employment preference to young artists and use a profit sharing program to provide them with substantial enough compensation to allow them time to focus on their craft.
A place for eXceptional music...
Young musicians who are typically excluded from other venues because of their age will no longer be limited to performing at school and church. They will be able to perform at an all-ages open mic night.  EXceptional young musicians will be selected to perform as featured performers on Saturday nights.  Vocalists young and not-so-young will be able to share the stage and enjoy a karaoke night without the pressures of alcohol.  At the end of the year, a live compilation CD will be produced featuring one song from each featured artist.
Walls to eXplore eXemplary art...
Each month, a panel of local arts professionals will choose an artist to be showcased on the walls of the cafe.  At the end of each year, EXpresso Coffee will produce a calendar featuring the works and biography of each month's artist.  EXpresso Coffee will host a gallery opening and closing event that will give the audience an opportunity to experience the art under the guidance of the mind that created it.  Artists will also be able to sell their work from the cafe without a consignment fee.
EXpresso Coffee will reach out to local organization like Pittsburgh CAPA, the Art Institute of Pittsburgh, Point Park University, The Manchester Craftsman's Guild and other local schools and organizations to ensure that young artists and musicians are made aware of this eXcellent opportunity for eXposure.
Some eXtraordinary partners...
We've teamed up with a local young artist and young singer/song-writer to help kick of the creativity. 
For the first few months of business,  the  unique recycle/reuse art work of Drea Bolen will be displayed on the walls of EXpresso Coffee.  Drea will be creating five original pieces of recycled art based on our theme, "Coffee...fueling creativity."  Imagine a replica of Botticelli's Venus or DaVinci's Man painted on a coffee filter canvas using various coffees for the various shades and hues.  These five brand new pieces are available to backers at the $7,500 level with and eXplosion of other fun rewards.
Here are some of examples of Drea's other work.  
You can also check her out at Drea's Playhouse.

Rewards to eXcite you...
From here on out, every reward level also includes having a caricature likeness of you (or someone you gift it to) drawn on our "Facial EXpressions" wall!
Imagine a place where coffee fuels creativity.
Imagine, EXpresso Coffee.

Hello, Good People!
My name is J.G. Boccella and I am an independent recording artist. My two greatest passions in life are music and bringing people together.
I am seeking $2,500 for my first-ever music video. (That’s the bare minimum that I think I need to make something nice, so any extra will just give us more options.) The song is called “UNSTOPPABLE” and it explores the idea of accepting the inevitability of change – in life and society.  The song will be featured on my second full-length CD.  The video is set 30-40 years in future, and imagines what changes in societal norms and law will have taken place by then.  Here are the lyrics to the chorus:
You can’t stop an idea whose time has come
No use runnin’, cause where you gonna run?
Don’t fear change ‘cause it’s bound to come
It’s UNSTOPPABLE.
As a songwriter, I like to blend musical styles and try to create a unique sound out of this mix.  Lyrically, I write about life and love, as do many songwriters, but I also often write songs about race relations.  This song was a fan favorite from my first recording:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001KYMOGI/ref=dm_dp_trk2?ie=UTF8&qid=1317592650&sr=301-4
It’s called “If a Dog Bites You” and explores the idea of TRUST – how it’s lost and possibly regained.  The vignettes in the verses are based on real events that took place in my hometown of Pittsburgh, PA.
That first full-length CD was a “concept album” :-0  called, “The Divided States of America” and was an attempt to explore U.S. race relations from a different perspective.   You can hear it, and more of my music, here:
http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/the-divided-states-of-america/id6272826
This is my single called “CHANGE”
http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/change-single/id394057968
I have also explored these ideas in workshops that I have developed over the years and, currently, in a lecture series and book project called “The Conversation We COULD Be Having.”
I am also a painter.  You can see some of my work here: http://www.zazzle.com/gifts?ch=modomio 
 GOOD PEOPLE
I am so excited to be working with my Modo Mio Band-mates to record this, and also with some amazing film and video friends.  I know that all together – you, me, the band, and the film/video/visual artists – we can make this a GREAT, high-quality, evocative, jammin’, and thought-provoking piece.
WHAT YOU GET FOR WHAT YOU GIVE
I’m also so excited (as a music fan myself) to offer these great thank-you’s for your pledges of support.  Check it out!
For just a one dollar donation, you can download our live EP, “Live from the Guild."  
And, for just a five dollar donation, you can get the live EP download plus my full-length debut album, “The Divided States of America,” as a digital download!
Then, there are the signed CD’s, the private concerts, the original painting.  Check it all out, on the column on the right.
FINDING MY AUDIENCE
I remember a Bruce Springsteen quote where he was talking about how, now that he had finished making his record, he felt like he had to literally go out and FIND his audience.  That’s what I am trying to do now.  I want to find people who are really feeling this music.  And, my hope is that the video – as well as the Kickstarter community – will be able to help get my music out there to find the people who would be most moved by it.
All I want to do is make great music and bring people together.  Please help me find my audience.  
Many Thanks.
PEACE&BLESSINGS,
JG

Hi Friends and Family,
I am recording a CD called "Life Jacket". I would like you to come with me on this journey.
Some Background: In early 2010 I said this little prayer, “Dear Lord, please give me the gift of songwriting”. (I highly recommend this “songwriters’ prayer” to anyone who writes.) Though I have written songs for many years, since that day, the songs began coming together in a new way. Simple…but powerful! Ask…and when it is the right thing for your life...Receive. This CD is the outgrowth of that request and my way of honoring the music that has come.
About the CD: I have named the CD “Life Jacket” because the CD will help me continue on that path I have been on since 2008 when I began to pursue art and music on a full time basis. I have written most of the music on my own or with co-writers like my wonderful husband George Salamacha. Stylistically, most of the songs are country/pop with a rock edge, like Keith Urban and Taylor Swift. If you like the rowdiness of Delbert McClinton, the heart-felt lyrics of Patty Griffin or the honesty of Lucinda Williams, I do believe you will like what I am doing.
About Recording: Phenomenal musicians in Nashville are doing most of the music tracks and there are Pittsburghers too like, Joy Ike on vocals, Bob Kardacz on keyboard, Bob Bannergee on the mandolin, George Salamacha on bass.
Project Info: So dear friends, family and fans, thank you for considering contributing. I have estimated that “Life Jacket” will cost between $6-$8000. I'm raising $3000 and am taking responsibility for the other half.
Here are all the expenses I will need to cover: *studio time *paying musicians *mixing/mastering *artwork, design, packaging and duplication of CD *promotion
THANK YOU for the support you have given me in the past several years. I will do my best to be a good steward of your money, give you an account of how I've spent it, and also give you EXCELLENT REWARDS in return (see rewards to your right). The names of all who pay-it-forward on “Life Jacket” will be on the liner notes of the CD jacket. If you are an individual or even a corporation, there’s a way to contribute.
Kickstarter Project Caveat: I need to mention that if the full $3,000 is not raised over the next 90 days, I will not receive any of the pledged money (and your credit card will not be charged). In other words, if I raise $2,995, that money will not come to me. If I meet or exceed $3,000, I will be eternally grateful and your name will be engraved in my heart forever.
At the completion of this project, we’ll have a big party…and there will be joy! Thanks from the bottom of my heart for your support.

It's all downhill after that. I have some cool Tshirts picked out too. Details on the CD release party will be forth coming. Shooting for early May.
